objectives.title: Design Secure Architectures
objectives.description: Design secure access to AWS resources, secure application tiers, and select appropriate data security options

objectives.title: Design Resilient Architectures
objectives.description: Design scalable and loosely coupled architectures, highly available and fault-tolerant architectures

objectives.title: Design High-Performing Architectures
objectives.description: Identify elastic and scalable compute solutions, high-performing storage and database solutions

objectives.title: Design Cost-Optimized Architectures
objectives.description: Identify cost-effective storage, compute, database, and network architecture solutions

questions.questionText: Which AWS service provides a managed NoSQL database with single-digit millisecond performance?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that provides fast and predictable performance with seamless scalability, offering single-digit millisecond latency at any scale.

questions.questionText: What is the maximum size of an object that can be stored in Amazon S3?
questions.explanation: The maximum size for a single object stored in Amazon S3 is 5 TB. Objects larger than 5 GB must be uploaded using multipart upload.

questions.questionText: Which AWS service should you use to distribute content with low latency to users worldwide?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) service that delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs globally with low latency and high transfer speeds.

questions.questionText: Which feature of Amazon VPC allows instances in a private subnet to connect to the internet?
questions.explanation: A NAT Gateway enables instances in a private subnet to connect to the internet or other AWS services while preventing the internet from initiating connections to those instances.

questions.questionText: What is the AWS Well-Architected Framework pillar that focuses on protecting information and systems?
questions.explanation: The Security pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework focuses on protecting information and systems, including data confidentiality, integrity, privilege management, and threat detection.

questions.questionText: Which storage class should you use for infrequently accessed data that requires rapid access when needed?
questions.explanation: S3 Standard-IA (Infrequent Access) is designed for data that is accessed less frequently but requires rapid access when needed. It offers lower storage costs than S3 Standard.

questions.questionText: Which AWS service provides serverless compute capacity?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that runs code in response to events and automatically manages the underlying compute resources, eliminating the need to provision or manage servers.

questions.questionText: What is the minimum number of Availability Zones recommended for high availability?
questions.explanation: AWS recommends using at least 2 Availability Zones for high availability. This ensures your application can continue operating if one AZ experiences an outage.

questions.questionText: Which database service automatically scales storage capacity as your database grows?
questions.explanation: Both Amazon Aurora and DynamoDB automatically scale storage. Aurora can scale up to 128 TB, while DynamoDB has virtually unlimited storage with automatic scaling.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of AWS IAM?
options: To manage access to AWS services and resources
questions.explanation: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) enables you to manage access to AWS services and resources securely. You can create and manage users, groups, and permissions.

questions.questionText: Which service would you use to decouple components of a distributed application?
questions.explanation: All these services can decouple components: SQS provides message queuing, SNS enables pub/sub messaging, and Step Functions orchestrates distributed applications and microservices.

questions.questionText: What is the maximum retention period for Amazon SQS messages?
questions.explanation: Amazon SQS can retain messages for a maximum of 14 days. The default retention period is 4 days, but it can be configured from 1 minute to 14 days.

questions.questionText: Which AWS service provides a fully managed container orchestration service?
questions.explanation: All are container services: ECS is AWS's native container orchestration service, EKS provides managed Kubernetes, and Fargate is a serverless compute engine for containers.

questions.questionText: What type of EBS volume provides the highest performance for I/O intensive workloads?
questions.explanation: Provisioned IOPS SSD (io2) volumes provide the highest performance EBS storage option, designed for I/O intensive workloads requiring sustained IOPS performance.

questions.questionText: Which pricing model offers the largest discount for EC2 instances?
questions.explanation: Spot Instances can provide up to 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices. However, they can be interrupted when EC2 needs the capacity back.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of AWS CloudFormation?
options: To provision and manage infrastructure as code
questions.explanation: AWS CloudFormation provides a way to model and provision AWS and third-party resources using infrastructure as code, allowing you to treat infrastructure as code.

questions.questionText: Which service provides a petabyte-scale data warehouse solution?
questions.explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse service designed for analyzing data using standard SQL and existing business intelligence tools.

questions.questionText: What is the minimum duration for purchasing a Standard Reserved Instance?
questions.explanation: Standard Reserved Instances have a minimum purchase duration of 1 year. You can choose between 1-year and 3-year terms, with 3-year terms offering larger discounts.

questions.questionText: Which AWS service can automatically scale EC2 instances based on demand?
questions.explanation: AWS Auto Scaling monitors applications and automatically adjusts capacity to maintain steady, predictable performance at the lowest possible cost.

questions.questionText: What is the durability of S3 Standard storage class?
questions.explanation: S3 Standard storage class is designed for 99.999999999% (11 9's) durability of objects over a given year, protecting against site-level failures.

questions.questionText: Which service would you use to create a hybrid cloud storage solution?
questions.explanation: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid cloud storage service that gives you on-premises access to virtually unlimited cloud storage, enabling hybrid cloud architectures.

questions.questionText: What is the maximum number of security groups that can be attached to an EC2 instance?
questions.explanation: By default, you can assign up to 5 security groups to an EC2 instance. This limit can be increased by contacting AWS support.

questions.questionText: Which feature allows you to control traffic between subnets in a VPC?
questions.explanation: Network ACLs (Access Control Lists) act as a firewall for controlling traffic in and out of subnets. They provide an additional layer of security at the subnet level.

questions.questionText: What service provides a managed Kubernetes service on AWS?
questions.explanation: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) is a fully managed Kubernetes service that makes it easy to deploy, manage, and scale containerized applications using Kubernetes.

questions.questionText: Which AWS service helps you optimize costs by providing recommendations?
questions.explanation: All these services help optimize costs: Cost Explorer analyzes spending, Trusted Advisor provides best practice recommendations, and Compute Optimizer recommends optimal AWS resources.

questions.questionText: What is the default limit for the number of VPCs per region?
questions.explanation: The default limit is 5 VPCs per region per AWS account. This is a soft limit that can be increased by requesting a limit increase from AWS support.

questions.questionText: Which database migration service helps migrate databases to AWS with minimal downtime?
questions.explanation: AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) helps migrate databases to AWS quickly and securely. The source database remains fully operational during migration, minimizing downtime.

questions.questionText: What is the primary benefit of using AWS CloudTrail?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail enables governance, compliance, operational auditing, and risk auditing by logging and continuously monitoring API calls made within your AWS account.

questions.questionText: Which service provides in-memory caching to improve application performance?
questions.explanation: Amazon ElastiCache offers fully managed in-memory data stores with Redis or Memcached, enabling you to retrieve information from fast, managed, in-memory systems.

questions.questionText: What is the maximum size of an item in DynamoDB?
questions.explanation: The maximum item size in DynamoDB is 400 KB, including both attribute names and values. For larger data, consider storing it in S3 and keeping references in DynamoDB.
